recipes.title: Grilled Chicken Breast with Steamed Vegetables
directions: Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Grill the chicken over medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side until fully cooked.
While the chicken is grilling, steam the broccoli and carrots until tender.
Serve the grilled chicken with steamed vegetables.

recipes.title: Baked Salmon with Asparagus and Lemon
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Arrange asparagus around the salmon and drizzle with olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper and place lemon slices on top of the salmon.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until the salmon is fully cooked.
Serve with the roasted asparagus.

recipes.title: Turkey and Quinoa Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
directions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large pan, heat olive oil and sauté the onion and garlic until soft.
Add the ground turkey and cook until browned.
Stir in the cooked quinoa and tomato sauce, and season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the bell peppers with the turkey and quinoa mixture.
Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Grilled Tofu with Stir-Fried Vegetables
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, drained and pressed
2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, snap peas)
directions: Slice the tofu into thick slabs and marinate in soy sauce for 10 minutes.
Heat a grill or grill pan over medium heat and grill the tofu for 4-5 minutes per side until grill marks appear.
In a large pan, heat sesame oil and sauté the ginger and garlic until fragrant.
Add the mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Serve the grilled tofu with the stir-fried vegetables.

recipes.title: Lemon-Garlic Shrimp with Zucchini Noodles
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: In a large pan, heat olive oil and sauté the garlic until fragrant.
Add the shrimp, lemon juice, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.
Cook the shrimp until pink and opaque, about 3-4 minutes.
Toss in the zucchini noodles and cook for another 2-3 minutes until tender.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

recipes.title: Grilled Steak with Roasted Brussels Sprouts
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the Brussels sprouts with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread them on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes until crispy and golden.
Meanwhile, season the steaks with salt and pepper and grill to desired doneness (about 4-6 minutes per side).
Serve the grilled steak with roasted Brussels sprouts.

recipes.title: Baked Cod with Roasted Butternut Squash
ingredients: 1 small butternut squash, peeled and cubed
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the butternut squash with olive oil, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread the squash on a baking sheet and roast for 15 minutes.
Place the cod fillets on the same baking sheet and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for an additional 10 minutes until the cod is cooked through.
Serve the baked cod with roasted butternut squash.

recipes.title: Chicken Stir-Fry with Snow Peas
ingredients: 1 pound chicken breast, sliced into thin strips
directions: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and ginger and sauté until fragrant.
Add the chicken strips and cook until no longer pink.
Stir in the bell pepper and snow peas, and add soy sauce.
Cook for another 3-4 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Squash with Turkey Marinara
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds.
Place cut side down on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté the onion and garlic until soft.
Add the ground turkey and cook until browned.
Stir in marinara sauce and season with salt and pepper.
Use a fork to scrape the squash into spaghetti-like strands.
Top with turkey marinara sauce and serve.

recipes.title: Greek Chicken Salad
directions: In a large bowl, combine the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil and lemon juice.
Add the cubed chicken to the salad and toss with the dressing.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.

recipes.title: Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
directions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix cooked quinoa, diced tomatoes, spinach, Parmesan cheese, and garlic.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the portobello mushrooms with the mixture and place them on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake for 20 minutes.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Lentil and Vegetable Stew
directions: In a large pot, heat olive oil and sauté the onion and garlic until soft.
Add carrots, celery, and dried lentils and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and thyme.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipes.title: Cauliflower Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, grated into rice-sized pieces
directions: Heat sesame oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add frozen peas and carrots and cook until tender.
Push vegetables to one side of the pan and pour beaten eggs into the empty side, scrambling until cooked.
Add cauliflower rice and soy sauce, and stir everything together.
Cook for another 5 minutes until the cauliflower is tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipes.title: Spicy Chicken and Sweet Potato Skillet
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
directions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sweet potatoes and cook until they start to soften, about 10 minutes.
Add the cubed chicken, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper.
Cook until the chicken is fully cooked and sweet potatoes are tender, about 10 more minutes.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Zucchini and Chicken Meatballs
directions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, mix ground chicken, zucchini, Parmesan cheese, egg, garlic, basil, salt, and pepper.
Form into meatballs and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes or until fully cooked.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Black Bean and Corn Tacos
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
directions: In a pan, heat olive oil and cook black beans and corn with chili powder and cumin for 5-7 minutes.
Warm corn tortillas in a separate pan or microwave.
Fill tortillas with black bean and corn mixture.
Top with diced avocado and chopped cilantro.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Chicken and Spinach Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Prick sweet potatoes with a fork and bake for 30 minutes until tender.
In a bowl, mix shredded chicken, spinach, Greek yogurt, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Once sweet potatoes are cooked, cut them open and fluff the insides with a fork.
Top with the chicken and spinach mixture.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Eggplant and Chickpea Curry
directions: In a large pan, heat olive oil and sauté the onion and garlic until soft.
Add diced eggplant and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in chickpeas, diced tomatoes, and curry powder.
Simmer for 15 minutes until eggplant is tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipes.title: Pork Tenderloin with Roasted Vegetables
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (potatoes, carrots, bell peppers)
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Season the pork tenderloin with salt, pepper, and rosemary.
Toss mixed vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Place the pork tenderloin on a baking sheet and surround with vegetables.
Roast for 25 minutes or until the pork reaches an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C).
Let the pork rest for 5 minutes before slicing.

recipes.title: Chili Lime Chicken with Avocado Salsa
directions: Season chicken breasts with chili powder and lime juice.
Grill or pan-cook chicken for 5-7 minutes per side until fully cooked.
In a bowl, combine avocado, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and cilantro to make the salsa.
Serve the chicken topped with avocado salsa.

recipes.title: Tofu Stir-Fry with Broccoli and Bell Peppers
directions: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add cubed tofu and cook until golden brown on all sides.
Add broccoli and bell pepper and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Stir in soy sauce and sesame seeds.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.

recipes.title: Salmon and Spinach Salad
directions: Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
Cook salmon in a pan with a little olive oil until cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
In a large bowl, combine spinach, red onion, and feta cheese.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Top the salad with cooked salmon fillets and serve.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Salad
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potato cubes with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes or until tender.
In a large bowl, combine roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, red onion, and cilantro.
Drizzle with lime juice and season with salt and pepper.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.title: Chicken and Vegetable Soup
directions: In a large pot, heat olive oil and sauté the onion and garlic until soft.
Add carrots, celery, and potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in chicken broth, diced chicken, and thyme.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25 minutes or until vegetables and chicken are cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipes.title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon
ingredients: 1 pound Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and top with chopped bacon.
Roast for 20 minutes or until Brussels sprouts are tender and bacon is crispy.
Serve warm.
